body: I rebased and fixed all tests. It is ready to review.
I rebased and fixed all tests. It is ready to review.
Fixed the test failure and rebased.

Thank you for your contribution.
I'm reviewing this PR. :)
@hyunsik would you close this PR?
This patch looks good to me. Would you rebase against master?

+1 this patch looks good to me.
Please fix the above condition before commit.
@hyunsik are you working on this issue? If not, please close this PR. We can open again when we need later.

I leaved a trivial comment.

And could you explain why you added `order by clause` to partial queries?
Overall, this patch looks good to me. Please consider my comments.
+1 LGTM.
@jinossy thanks! I've updated my patch.
@blrunner They were not deterministic. I added 'order by clause' to make some unit tests deterministic. 'deterministic' means that their results sometimes can be different.

Hi @hyunsik, I found some query plans are changed, especially related to broadcast join. I suppose this change is due to the table volumes stored in catalog, but it is difficult to find where the code is. Would you let me know some points where need to be reviewed?
Fixed that. Thank you.

@jihoonson Thank you for your comments. As we discussed in an offline, it may be hard to handle the problem in this issue. Instead, I just created the another jira [1] and add `FIXME` tags in the unit tests. We can resolve this problem after we introduce hints.

[1] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TAJO-2026

Thanks. It looks good to me. In that issue, we need to investigate the proper goal of each join tests and make them work properly.

This issue makes sense, so I'd like to help you to finish your work. If you still want to contribute this patch to Tajo, would you open this PR again or make a new one?

Merry christmas!

Hi @combineads 

Thank you for your contribution. But I don't sense that `sync` is right name for contribution. If you create a document file instead of shell script file, contributors will know that it is a guide for contribution by file name and readability of github would be better in comparison with shell script. I recommend the file name is `CONTRIBUTING.md`.
The Travis CI Build seems like a fail by another reason. Here is the pre-commit report by lasted patch as follows. https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-TAJO-Build/900//console
That's clear. My +1 here is.
first and last failure is not related this issue after jetty upgraded

Thanks @hyunsik. This patch looks good to me overall. I have one suggestion.

The patch looks good to me. Here are some comments.

Our coding standard uses 2 space instead of tab. Some lines do not follow the indent of our coding standard.  Please refer to https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/TAJO/Code+Style.

Other parts look good to me. Here is my +1. Could you correct line indents? Then, I'll commit it soon.

@hyunsik 

Thank you for your review.

Sorry @combineads, I thought about it again. Tajo already provides some documents for contributing as follows. https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/TAJO/How+to+Contribute+Codes+to+Tajo.
If possible, could you update existing wiki page? If you don't have a wiki account, you can request it to dev@tajo.apache.org.

Rebased. Basically, Tajo column partition focus on Hive partition compatibility. Currently, Hive just created timestamp partition directories using date format. I think that Tajo just need to follow current Hive version rule. Because even if we implement long value time for timestamp partition directory, Hive can't handle it.
This PR needs more modification deeply. I'll reopen this PR when I resolve all the problem about it.
